snippet: A stronger economy and slower growth in health spending have helped strengthen the financial outlook for the federal insurance program, the Obama administration said.
abstract: Obama administration says the financial outlook for Medicare has improved because of a stronger economy and slower growth in health spending, and the financial condition of Social Security has not worsened but is still unsustainable; under current law, the administration says, Medicare’s hospital insurance trust fund will be exhausted in 2026, and the Social Security Trust Fund will be depleted in 2033.
lead_paragraph: A stronger economy and slower growth in health spending have helped strengthen the financial outlook for the federal insurance program, the Obama administration said.

headline.seo: Medicare Outlook Improves Slightly, Report Shows
headline.main: Report Shows Better Outlook for Medicare
headline.print_headline: Report Shows Better Outlook For Medicare

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
